title: Leonard Cohen "Songs of Love and Hate" album cover
content:
Can anyone help me identify the tyeface used on this Leonard Cohen album cover please?

Any other nice display style font suggestions would be appreciated. I like the look of Fedra Sans Dispay and Fat Ed (custom font by Underware not available).

Thanks,

Dom

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Leonard\_Cohen.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907002615/http:/typophile.com/files/Leonard_Cohen.jpg) | 48.48 KB |

 [‹ (x) Sween & Salazar, Ltd. logo - Century Schoolbook {Mike Y}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907002615/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34407 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Superseal" curvy Art Nouveau sans - Hobo {Paul-Kenji Cahier} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907002615/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34395 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Dominic Forde

comments.content: For similar heavy weights, check out Font Bureau’s [Rhode](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907002615/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Rhode), or H&FJ’s [Knockout](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907002615/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/index.html) or [Leviathan](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907002615/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/leviathan/index.html).

This is, or was derived from, 19th- and 20th-century wood type. There are several digital revivals with various degrees of fidelity to the funkiness of the original forms.

H&FJ Champion Heavyweight  
 [http://www.typography.com/catalog/champion/testdriver/heavy.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907002615/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/champion/testdriver/heavy.html "http://www.typography.com/catalog/champion/testdriver/heavy.html")

Smokler (Dennis Ortiz-Lopez  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/ol-smokler/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907002615/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/ol-smokler/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/ol-smokler/")

Much funkier:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/antique-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907002615/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/antique-sans/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/antique-sans/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/wooddale/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907002615/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/wooddale/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/wooddale/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/brazos-wbw/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907002615/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/brazos-wbw/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/brazos-wbw/")

Thanks guys, Rhode looks like an interesting option.

Dom
Yes, it’s a shame Fat Ed is not for sale, or I would have bought it.

These guys have really awesome woodtype:

[http://withoutwalls.com/index.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907002615/http:/withoutwalls.com/index.htm "http://withoutwalls.com/index.htm")

(and shapes too)
